diff_hunk:
@@ -132,7 +132,7 @@ export const isFilteringActive = state =>
  * Get all filters as an object keyed on their slug
  *
  * @param  {Array<Object>} groups All filter groups
body_text:
D'oh, sorry.
The reason for using list was that it was more descriptive of what the function expected (it wants state.filters.list). However, looking at the other selectors in that file, they all expect the general state object, and then pull out what they need from there. I've changed getFilterObject to now accept the state object to conform to conventions.
I also noticed that a bunch of the docstrings were inaccurate, so I corrected those while I was in there, as well.
body:
D'oh, sorry.

The reason for using `list` was that it was more descriptive of what the function expected (it wants `state.filters.list`). However, looking at the other selectors in that file, they all expect the general `state` object, and then pull out what they need from there. I've changed `getFilterObject` to now accept the `state` object to conform to conventions.

I also noticed that a bunch of the docstrings were inaccurate, so I corrected those while I was in there, as well.
body_html:
D'oh, sorry.

The reason for using list was that it was more descriptive of what the function expected (it wants state.filters.list). However, looking at the other selectors in that file, they all expect the general state object, and then pull out what they need from there. I've changed getFilterObject to now accept the state object to conform to conventions.

I also noticed that a bunch of the docstrings were inaccurate, so I corrected those while I was in there, as well.
